newsitem.title: UK: Woolwich Building Society seeks 300 mln stg.
newsitem.headline: Woolwich Building Society seeks 300 mln stg.

text.p: LONDON, Aug 28 (LPC) - The Woolwich Building Society has mandated JP Morgan to arrange a 300 million stg revolving credit facility, market sources said.
The facility includes a $225 million swingline option for same-day advances in US dollars.
The loan will be used to provide the Woolwich with additional liquidity backstop financing.
The credit bears interest at 15 bps over LIBOR and carries a commitment fee of 7 bps.
In May 1995 Woolwich borrowed 300 million stg via a group led by Morgan and WestLB. That five-year deal was priced 18 bps over LIBOR with a 7.25 bps commitment fee.
